attributes.description: For more than 40 years, the BMW 3 Series, with its combination of luxury and rear-wheel-driven dynamic agility, has won favour with buyers looking for something a little more dashing than its business-suited segment rivals. BMW has carefully instituted aesthetic changes that remain close to its predecessor, while moving the game along without ruffling too many feathers. Perhaps the most noteworthy elements are BMWâs more angular take on its signature kidney grille and much narrower, L-shaped brakelamps that lend the rear a bit of visual width. Otherwise, the taut sheetmetal and proportions are unmistakably 3 Series
